Prerequisites: ACG3024 FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS FOR MANAGERS
Course Description: THIS COURSE HELPS STUDENTS BECOME SKILLED PREPARERS AND INFORMED CONSUMERS OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT INFORMATION.  EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON UNDERSTANDING THE ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH FINANCIAL REPORTING CHOICES ARE MADE, WHAT THE OPTIONS ARE AND HOW ACCOUNTING INFORMATION IS USED FOR DECISION MAKING.  INCLUDED IS THE INCORPORATION OF FASB AND IASB STANDARDS AND THEIR ROLE IN THE DECISION MAKING PROCESS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1)	STRENGTHEN STUDENTS’ UNDERSTANDING OF THE ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, METHODS AND DISCLOSURES UNDERLYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
2)	IDENTIFY AND APPLY TOOLS AND TECHNIQUES FOR THE APPROPRIATE ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
3)	ANALYZE THE INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND ALL ADDITIONAL NOTES AND REPORTS WHICH FORM PART OF THE FINANCIAL REPORT OF AN ORGANIZATION.
4)	EXAMINE THE IMPACT THAT THE CHOICE OF ACCOUNTING METHODS AND MANAGEMENT ESTIMATES HAVE ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
5)	CONSIDER HOW REPORTED FINANCIAL STATEMENT INFORMATION CAN BE ADJUSTED TO CREATE MORE USEFUL INPUT FOR FINANCIAL ANALYSIS.
6)	WRITE AN EFFECTIVE REPORT THAT ANALYSES AND PROVIDES JUSTIFICATION FOR DECISION MAKING.
